intro: Picris kamtschatica, commonly known as Siberian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosette. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Picris kamtschatica is often found in tundra and subarctic environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
